title: No children node listing when changing data source for a dataset in the query tab's dataset editor page
OB: When changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: When changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab, there should be a listing of children nodes.
SR:
1. Create a new dataset without an SQL statement.
2. Open the dataset editor and go to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one.
4. Verify that the new data source has database/table/column information listed as children nodes.
5. Close the dataset editor page and reopen it to confirm the issue persists.
